title: RRB Clerk Prelims: Reasoning (7th Dec Shift 2) #RA005

questions.text:
Directions (1-5): Eight persons A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H sit around a square table. Four sit at corner facing inside and three sit at the middle of each side facing outside. Two persons sit between A and B. B faces inside. F sits immediate right of A. D sits adjacent to F and G. C sits second to the right of H.

Q1. What is the position of C with respect to F?
questions.solution: Based on the arrangement, C is third to the right of F. (Solution S1: Ans.(e))

questions.text: Q2. How many persons sit between E and H (when counted from the right of H)?
questions.solution: Two persons sit between E and H. (Solution S2: Ans.(c))

questions.text: Q3. Who among the following sits immediate left of G?
questions.solution: H sits immediate left of G. (Solution S3: Ans.(d))

questions.text: Q4. Four of the following five are similar in a certain manner and form a group, who among the following is not related to the group?
questions.solution: D is the odd one out (likely based on facing direction or position). (Solution S4: Ans.(d))

questions.text: Q5. If all the persons are asked to sit in alphabetical order, starting from A, in clockwise direction, then how many persons will remain same on their position (excluding A)?
questions.solution: None of the persons remain in the same position. (Solution S5: Ans.(b))

questions.text:
Directions (6-10): In a certain code language:
'Apple farmers supply fruits' is coded as 'kl zu rt mw'
'Fresh mango supply today' is coded as 'rt ds pq ne'
'Farmers sell apple today' is coded as 'zu kl ne tx'
'Mango fruits taste sweet' is coded as 'ds mw jy ab'

Q6. What is the code for 'sell'?
questions.solution: From statements 1 and 3, 'Farmers' and 'Apple' are 'zu' and 'kl'. 'Today' is 'ne' (from 2 & 3). Remaining 'sell' is 'tx'. (Solution S6: Ans.(a))

questions.text: Q7. What will be the code for 'fruits supply'?
questions.solution: 'Fruits' is 'mw' (from 1 & 4) and 'Supply' is 'rt' (from 1 & 2). Code is 'mw rt'. (Solution S7: Ans.(c))

questions.text: Q8. Which of the following word is coded as 'kl'?
questions.solution: 'kl' could be either 'Farmers' or 'Apple'. (Solution S8: Ans.(e))

questions.text: Q9. If 'sweet corn' is coded as 'jy hm', then what will be the code for 'Taste'?
questions.solution: In statement 4, 'Taste/Sweet' is 'jy/ab'. If 'Sweet' is 'jy', then 'Taste' is 'ab'. (Solution S9: Ans.(d))

questions.text: Q10. What may be the code for 'mango juice today'?
questions.solution: 'Mango' is 'ds', 'Today' is 'ne'. 'Juice' is a new word requiring a new code ('op'). Code: 'ds op ne'. (Solution S10: Ans.(b))

questions.text:
Directions (11-13): Statements: K > R >= T = W < J <= B = F
Conclusions:
I. R < J
II. T >= F
options: If only conclusion I is true
If only conclusion II is true
If either conclusion I or II is true
If both conclusion I and II are true
If neither conclusion I nor II is true
questions.solution: I. R >= T = W < J (Relationship cannot be determined). II. T = W < J <= B = F (T < F, so T >= F is false). Neither follows. (Solution S11: Ans.(e))

questions.text:
Q12. Statements: Z >= K < P = V <= R <= T < Y
Conclusions:
I. K < Y
II. Z > R
options: If only conclusion I is true
If only conclusion II is true
If either conclusion I or II is true
If both conclusion I and II are true
If neither conclusion I nor II is true
questions.solution: I. K < P ... < Y (True). II. Z >= K < P ... <= R (False). Only I follows. (Solution S12: Ans.(a))

questions.text:
Q13. Statements: H = X <= L < N; D >= L
Conclusions:
I. L < N
II. D >= H
options: If only conclusion I is true
If only conclusion II is true
If either conclusion I or II is true
If both conclusion I and II are true
If neither conclusion I nor II is true
questions.solution: I. L < N is directly given (True). II. D >= L >= X = H (True). Both follow. (Solution S13: Ans.(d))

questions.text: Q14. How many pairs of letters are in the word 'MISTAKE', each of which have as many letters between them as they have between them according to English alphabetical order?
questions.solution: The pair is S-T. (Solution S14: Ans.(a))

questions.text:
Directions (15-19): Seven boxes A, B, C, D, E, F and G are placed one above the other. Four boxes are placed between box G and box B. Box D is placed two boxes above box B. Box A is placed immediately below box D. Box C is placed two boxes above box F.

Q15. Which box is placed third from the topmost position?
questions.solution: Arrangement (Top to Bottom): C, G, F, E, D, A, B. 3rd box is F. (Solution S15: Ans.(a))

questions.text: Q16. How many boxes are placed below box D?
questions.solution: Below D are A and B (2 boxes). (Solution S16: Ans.(b))

questions.text: Q17. If all the boxes are rearranged in alphabetical order from bottom to top, then how many boxes will remain same at their position?
questions.solution: Original: B, A, D, E, F, G, C. Alphabetical: A, B, C, D, E, F, G. None match. (Solution S17: Ans.(e))

questions.text: Q18. If box C is related to box G, in the similar way box F is related to box E, then which box is related to box B?
questions.solution: Relation is 'Immediately Below'. C->G, F->E. For B (at bottom), there is no box below, but checking solution: Ans.(c) corresponds to Box A (which is immediately above B, suggesting the relation might be inverted or specific logic). Based on PDF Solution S18: Ans.(c) is Box A.

questions.text: Q19. Which box is placed immediately below box E?
questions.solution: Immediately below E is D. (Solution S19: Ans.(d))

questions.text: Q20. Find the odd one out.
questions.solution: Logic: +3 pattern. I(+3)=L, L(+2)=N (Odd). Others are +3, +3. (Solution S20: Ans.(c))

questions.text:
Directions (21-22): Point K is 11m north of B... Point C is 11m west of H...
Q21. Four of the following five are alike... Find the one pair of points which does NOT belong to the group?
questions.solution: K-H direction is North-West, others are North-East. (Solution S21: Ans.(d))

questions.text: Q22. In which direction is point K with respect to point A?
questions.solution: K is to the West of A. (Solution S22: Ans.(c))

questions.text:
Directions (23-26): Statements: Some play are games. Only a few games are indoor.
Conclusions:
I. Some games are not indoor
II. All play is indoor
options: Either conclusion I or II follows
Neither conclusion I nor II follows
Both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: Conclusion I follows. (Solution S23: Ans.(a))

questions.text:
Q24. Statements: All apple are fruits. Some fruits are not banana.
Conclusions:
I. Some banana is definitely not apples
II. No fruits are banana
options: Either conclusion I or II follows
Neither conclusion I nor II follows
Both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: Neither conclusion follows. (Solution S24: Ans.(d))

questions.text:
Q25. Statements: No pattern is visual. Only a few cluster is visual.
Conclusions:
I. Some pattern is cluster
II. No pattern is cluster
options: Either conclusion I or II follows
Neither conclusion I nor II follows
Both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: Either I or II follows (Complementary pairs). (Solution S25: Ans.(c))

questions.text:
Q26. Statements: Only a few river is blue. Some blue is ocean. No ocean is pond.
Conclusions:
I. Some blue is not pond
II. No river being pond is a possibility
options: Either conclusion I or II follows
Neither conclusion I nor II follows
Both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: Both conclusions follow. (Solution S26: Ans.(e))

questions.text:
Directions (27-29): Six pencils A, B, C, D, E, F... Two pencils longer than B... D > F > B (7cm) > A > C > E.
Q27. Which of the following pencil is 2nd shortest?
questions.solution: The 2nd shortest pencil is C. (Solution S27: Ans.(a))

questions.text: Q28. How many pencils are longer than A?
questions.solution: Three pencils (D, F, B) are longer than A. (Solution S28: Ans.(b))

questions.text: Q29. If total length of pencil D and B is 16 cm, then what will be the possible height of pencil F?
questions.solution: B=7, D+B=16 => D=9. F is between D and B (9 and 7). Possible height is 8 cm. (Solution S29: Ans.(d))

questions.text: Q30. Word 'ALTERNATES'. 2nd, 4th, 7th, 8th letters (L, E, A, T). Form meaningful words. If >1 answer Z.
questions.solution: Words formed: LATE, TALE, TEAL. Answer Z. (Solution S30: Ans.(d))

questions.text:
Directions (31-35): WIN KEY JAM LOG CAT
Q31. If all the words are arranged in dictionary order from left, then which word will become 3rd from the right end?
questions.solution: Order: CAT, JAM, KEY, LOG, WIN. 3rd from right is KEY. (Solution S31: Ans.(a))

questions.text: Q32. If 3rd letter is changed to its next letter... how many words will have more than one vowel?
questions.solution: Words: WIO, CAU. Two words. (Solution S32: Ans.(e))

questions.text: Q33. If letter 'D' is added at the end of each word... how many meaningful words?
questions.solution: Only 'WIND' is meaningful. One word. (Solution S33: Ans.(c))

questions.text: Q34. How many letters between first letter of second word from left (K) and third letter of third word from right (M)?
questions.solution: Between K and M is L (1 letter). (Solution S34: Ans.(b))

questions.text: Q35. If all letters are arranged in dictionary order from left within each word, how many words start with vowel?
questions.solution: INW, EKY, AJM, ACT. Four words. (Solution S35: Ans.(c))

questions.text:
Directions (36-40): Six persons B, C, D, E, F, G born on Mon-Sat.
Q36. G was born on which of the following day?
questions.solution: G was born on Wednesday. (Solution S36: Ans.(b))

questions.text: Q37. Who among the following was born on Saturday?
questions.solution: C was born on Saturday. (Solution S37: Ans.(e))

questions.text: Q38. Which of the following combination is correct?
questions.solution: F - Monday is correct. (Solution S38: Ans.(d))

questions.text: Q39. How many persons were born before E?
questions.solution: Three persons were born before E. (Solution S39: Ans.(c))

questions.text: Q40. Which of the following statement is correct?
questions.solution: Statements I and II are correct. (Solution S40: Ans.(b))
